Empathy is a Governance Skill.

To serve effectively, one must first understand the lived reality of those on the margins. Service is my education in reality.

Guide Dogs Singapore

Student Volunteer (2024)

Assisted in public awareness campaigns and logistical support. My time here taught me that accessibility is not just an architectural checkbox, but a fundamental dignity. It reinforced the belief that policy must always be designed with the most vulnerable user in mind.

Special Olympics

Student Volunteer (2023)

Supported athletes in training and events. Witnessing the grit and determination of these athletes challenged my own definitions of "potential" and "limitation." It underscored the importance of creating inclusive spaces where every citizen can contribute.

Connect

I am always looking for opportunities to learn, serve, and contribute to meaningful projects. If you are working on something that matters, I would love to hear from you.

melvin@example.com

"Governance. Law. Service."
